title: How to Peel an Onion Quickly

steps.title: Cut an onion in half vertically.
steps.content: Cut an onion in half vertically.

steps.title: Place the halves "cut side down" on the cutting board.
steps.content: Place the halves "cut side down" on the cutting board.

steps.title: Cut off the unusable portions at the top and bottom of each half.
steps.content: Cut off the unusable portions at the top and bottom of each half.

steps.title: Peel back the top layer of each onion half.
steps.content: Peel back the top layer of each onion half. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Rinse the onion halves under cold water to remove any peel residue.
steps.content: Rinse the onion halves under cold water to remove any peel residue. Rinsing also reduces the residue that causes your eyes to water when handling onions. [2] X Research source

steps.title: When an onion is halved, it is much easier to cut into thin slices.
steps.content: When an onion is halved, it is much easier to cut into thin slices.

steps.title: Turn your cutting board ninety degrees after slicing, and you can easily dice your onion as well.
steps.content: Turn your cutting board ninety degrees after slicing, and you can easily dice your onion as well.

steps.title: Cut the onion in half.
steps.content: Cut the onion in half. Cut off the unusable parts (top and bottom).

steps.title: Stab the cut side with a fork.
steps.content: Stab the cut side with a fork. Hold the skin side against the base of the warming frying pan.

steps.title: Wait until the papery part of the skin loosens.
steps.content: Wait until the papery part of the skin loosens. Lift the onion right and you'll be able easily pull off the skin.
